pullRequest.title: Add Amazon Services transport truststore configuration
pullRequest.bodyText:
Implementation for #10888.
I still need to test things out.
But could you already look at the design of the implementation, if its ok for you or if you have suggestions to implement this in a better way.

nodes.bodyText: Please add javadoc here explaining the purpose of this class
Maybe it's safer to use platform default trustmanager algorithm via TrustManagerFactory.getDefaultAlgorithm() ?
Same here, please add some javadoc here
couple words explanations  (javadoc) would be usefull
maybe trust-all would be a better name, wdyt ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,35 @@
+package io.quarkus.amazon.common.runtime;
+
+import io.quarkus.runtime.annotations.ConfigGroup;
+import io.quarkus.runtime.annotations.ConfigItem;
+
+@ConfigGroup
+public class TlsTrustManagersProviderConfig {
+
+    // @formatter:off
+    /**
+     * TLS trust managers provider type.
+     *
+     * Available providers:
+     *
+     * * `insecure` - Use this provider if you don't want to validate the servers certificates.

beforeCommit.message: add missing trustmanager configuration to urlconnectionclient

nodes.bodyText: I'm a bit late to the party but let's go with trust-all. It's more consistent with the other parts of the code.
